summary: This is the First Quarterly Accounting (covering August 10, 2019 to December 31, 2019) for the Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein, filed in the Superior Court of the Virgin Islands. It details the estate's assets, cash flow, expenses, and lists numerous civil lawsuits filed against the estate and its executors. This document contains multiple bank statements and relationship summaries for accounts held in the name of Jeffrey E. Epstein at 1First Bank and Banco Popular de Puerto Rico. It shows significant financial activity, including large deposits, withdrawals, and transactions in 2018-2019, primarily from commercial checking accounts.

connections.description: Served together as co-executors of the Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein, jointly responsible for filing the quarterly accounting and named together in numerous lawsuits.
Darren K. Indyke is a co-executor of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, responsible for its administration.
Richard D. Kahn is a co-executor of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, responsible for its administration.
Attorney P Kroblin's firm (Kellerhals Ferguson Kroblin) prepared and submitted the estate accounting on behalf of the co-executors.
Ghislaine Maxwell is named as a co-defendant with Epstein's estate in multiple civil lawsuits alleging abuse.
Both are named as defendants in civil lawsuits related to Jeffrey Epstein's alleged conduct.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The date Jeffrey E. Epstein died, marking the start of the estate administration period covered in this accounting.

events.title: Funeral and Cemetery Expenses Paid
events.description: The estate paid $16,308 for cemetery expenses and $50,064 for funeral home expenses.

events.title: First Civil Lawsuit Filed
events.description: A summons and complaint were filed in New York Supreme Court (Jane Doe v. Estate of Jeffrey Edward Epstein, et al.), marking the beginning of a wave of civil litigation.

events.title: Large Transfers to Southern Country International, Ltd.
events.description: The estate made two large payments totaling $15.5 million to Southern Country International, Ltd., an entity owned by the estate.

events.title: Filing of First Quarterly Accounting
events.description: The co-executors filed this detailed accounting of the estate's finances with the Superior Court of the Virgin Islands.

events.title: Multiple $25,000 Debits
events.description: A series of $25,000 debit transactions from a 1First Bank account, labeled with various ACX DB transaction codes.

events.title: Large Deposits and Withdrawals
events.description: A $2,600,000.00 deposit and a $14,923.94 check transaction recorded on the same day.

events.title: Bank Relationship Summary
events.description: A summary from Banco Popular de Puerto Rico showing account details and balances for Jeffrey E. Epstein.

locations: Superior Court of the Virgin Islands Division of St. Thomas and St. John
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's estate was valued at approximately $628.3 million as of August 10, 2019, and grew to about $634.8 million by December 31, 2019.
The estate held assets in over 30 shell companies and entities, including Southern Trust Company, Inc. (valued at ~$233.6M), Nautilus, Inc., and various LLCs.
Numerous civil lawsuits (at least 20 are listed) were filed against the estate and its executors, Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn, primarily by anonymous plaintiffs (Jane Does) alleging abuse.
The estate paid significant legal fees, including $11,041,591 to Steptoe & Johnson LLP and hundreds of thousands to Troutman Sanders LLP and Kellerhals Ferguson Kroblin.
The document reveals large financial movements, including a $15.5 million transfer to Southern Country International, Ltd. and the liquidation of several entity bank accounts.
Jeffrey Epstein maintained significant bank accounts at 1First Bank and Banco Popular de Puerto Rico, with balances in the millions of dollars.
Financial statements show a pattern of large transactions, including a single-day deposit of $2.6 million in December 2018.
Account summaries indicate a 'Popular Plus' checking account with a balance over $119,000 and details of electronic credits and service charges.
The documents are financial records subpoenaed or obtained as part of the investigation into Epstein's activities.
Transaction descriptions include codes and references that may correspond to payments, wire transfers, or other financial activities.
